word_mean: 胸，胸廓：颈与呼吸性膈肌之间的躯体部分，由肋骨包围

sentence.Network_en: The head, the thorax and the tail comprise the trumsverse segmentation.
sentence.Network_cn: 头 、 胸和尾具有横向的分节.

sentence.Network_en: It has a distinctly globular thorax.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的胸部明显地呈球形.

sentence.Network_en: The insects are tracheate arthropods in which the body is divided into head, thorax and abdomen.
sentence.Network_cn: 昆虫是有气管的节肢动物,体躯分为头部, 胸部和腹部.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek thōrax

entry.def: Your thorax is the part of your body between your neck and your waist.
An insect's thorax is the central part of its body to which the legs and wings are attached.

means.word_mean: 1. the middle region of the body of an arthropod between the head and the abdomen
2. the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates
3. part of an insect's body that bears the wings and legs

auth_sentence.content: They resemble flying ants but have no 'waist' between thorax and abdomen.
